content.webTitle: Fishlake flooding: how have you been affected?

fields.headline: Fishlake flooding: how have you been affected?
fields.bodyText: Last month, over a thousand properties were evacuated across the North of England and the Midlands after heavy downpours caused rivers to burst their banks. One of the heavily affected areas was Fishlake in Doncaster, where recovery work is still underway to clean up the aftermath of the floods. While over 100 homes were damaged, it’s believed that many residents are still living in temporary accommodation. We want to hear from Fishlake residents about what has happened since the endless TV cameras left the village. One of our reporters is heading back to Fishlake to find out how people have been affected. How to get in touch Was your home or business flooded? Are you still in temporary accommodation? Have you been able to claim insurance for the damage caused? Are you a member of the community who has been helping residents with donations, etc? How has the flood impacted you and your family? You can get in touch by filling in the form below, anonymously if you wish. Only the Guardian has access to your responses. One of our journalists may be in touch to discuss further as part of an upcoming news report. If you’re having trouble using the form, click here. Read terms of service here.
